summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The REGFILTERPINS structure contains pin information for registering a filter.

member.name: REGFILTERPINS.bRendered
member.summary: If TRUE, the filter renders the input from this pin. (Applies only to input pins. For output pins, the value is always FALSE.)

member.name: REGFILTERPINS.bOutput
member.summary: If TRUE, this pin is an output pin. Otherwise, the pin is an input pin.

member.name: REGFILTERPINS.bZero
member.summary: If TRUE, the filter can have zero instances of this pin.

member.name: REGFILTERPINS.bMany
member.summary: If TRUE, the filter can create more than one instance of this type of pin.

member.name: REGFILTERPINS.clsConnectsToFilter
member.summary: Class identifier (CLSID) of the filter to which this pin connects. (Obsolete.)

member.name: REGFILTERPINS.strConnectsToPin
member.summary: Name of the pin to which this pin connects. (Obsolete.)

member.name: REGFILTERPINS.nMediaTypes
member.summary: Number of media types supported by this pin.

member.name: REGFILTERPINS.lpMediaType
member.summary: Pointer to an array of structures, of size nMediaTypes.
